com.i2group.apollo.model.data.transport

Class CoreProperty

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.i2group.apollo.model.data.transport.CoreProperty
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IIdentifiable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Property, PropertyChange

    public abstract class CoreProperty
extends Object
implements IIdentifiable
    The core parts of a Property that are common to other commands or events.

    Throughout its lifetime, a property is subject to validation rules:

    • The identifier of the property must be unique in the context of the Item that owns its enclosing Card.
    • If the PropertyType of the property is mandatory, then neither getPropertyValue nor getPropertyValue.getValue must return null.
    • It is valid for the property to have no value (that is, for getPropertyValue to return null) but still to be graded. However, this does not satisfy a mandatory PropertyType.
    • The property must conform to the LogicalType of its PropertyType (see below).
    • The type identifiers of the property's Grades must correspond to GradeTypes in the Schema.
    • The values of the property's Grades must be valid according to their GradeTypes in the Schema.
    The LogicalTypes of PropertyTypes map directly onto the standard XML types defined in "W3C XML Schema Definition Language (XSD) 1.1 Part 2: Datatypes", version "W3C Recommendation 5 April 2012". Specifically:
    • Properties of type LogicalType.SINGLE_LINE_STRING must be represented as a SimplePropertyValue and conform to the "string" XML data type (section 3.3.1). In addition, the value may not contain any newline characters.
    • Properties of type LogicalType.MULTIPLE_LINE_STRING must be represented as a SimplePropertyValue and conform to the "string" XML data type (section 3.3.1).
    • Properties of type LogicalType.DATE must be represented as a SimplePropertyValue and conform to the "date" XML data type (section 3.3.9).
    • Properties of type LogicalType.TIME must be represented as a SimplePropertyValue and conform to the "time" XML data type (section 3.3.8).
    • Properties of type LogicalType.DATE_AND_TIME must be represented as a DateTimePropertyValue.
    • Properties of type LogicalType.BOOLEAN must be represented as a SimplePropertyValue and conform to the "boolean" XML data type (section 3.3.2). Validation supports the "boolean" XML data type as defined in the specification, but does not enforce it strictly. The values true, false, 1, and 0 are interpreted as defined in the specification. All other values are considered to be false; they are not considered invalid, and do not result in validation failure.
    • Properties of type LogicalType.INTEGER must be represented as a SimplePropertyValue and conform to the "int" XML data type (section 3.4.17).
    • Properties of type LogicalType.DOUBLE must be represented as a SimplePropertyValue and conform to the "double" XML data type (section 3.3.5).
    • Properties of type LogicalType.DECIMAL must be represented as a SimplePropertyValue and conform to the "decimal" XML data type (section 3.3.3).
    • Properties of type LogicalType.DOCUMENT must be represented as a DocumentPropertyValue.
    • Properties of type LogicalType.XML must be represented as an XmlPropertyValue.
    • Properties of type LogicalType.PICTURE must be represented as a PicturePropertyValue.
    • Properties of type LogicalType.GEOSPATIAL must be represented as a GeospatialPropertyValue.
    • Properties of type LogicalType.SELECTED_FROM must be represented as a SimplePropertyValue and conform to the "string" XML data type (section 3.3.1), and must be one of the values returned by PropertyType.getPossibleValues().
    • Properties of type LogicalType.SUGGESTED_FROM must be represented as a SimplePropertyValue and conform to the "string" XML data type (section 3.3.1).
    Since:
    3.0

    • Method Detail

      • setPropertyValue

        public void setPropertyValue(PropertyValue propertyValue)
        Sets the value of this CoreProperty to the specified PropertyValue.
        Parameters:
        propertyValue - A PropertyValue containing the value to be set.

      • getPropertyValue

        public PropertyValue getPropertyValue()
        Gets a PropertyValue containing the value of this CoreProperty.

        The type of this value corresponds to the LogicalType of the PropertyType identified by Property.getPropertyTypeId(). For a type such as LogicalType.DOCUMENT, the value may be a reference to the location of the data, rather than the data itself.

        Returns:
        See above.

      • getGrades

        public final Collection<Grade> getGrades()
        Gets the Grades of this CoreProperty, which indicate the quality of the information it contains.

        If the CoreProperty has been fully graded according to the Schema, there will be one Grade for each GradeType. Incomplete grading results in GradeTypes that are not represented.

        Returns:
        See above, or null if no Grades at all have been set.

      • setGrades

        public final void setGrades(Collection<Grade> grades)
        Sets the Grades of this CoreProperty to the specified values.
        Parameters:
        grades - The Grades to be set.

      • getAltText

        public final String getAltText()
        Gets a String containing the alternative text for this CoreProperty, which may be null if there is no sensible value.
        Returns:
        See above.

      • setAltText

        public final void setAltText(String altText)
        Sets the alternative text for this CoreProperty to the specified String.
        Parameters:
        altText - A String containing the alternative text.
